conversation.question: Given the following style attribute from an image in a website, generate another code with a new style property to get the illustration design better knowing that I want to reach the childrens audience. Style Attribute: display:block;max-width:100%;width:initial;height:initial;background:none;opacity:1;border:0;margin:0;padding:0.
conversation.response:
To make the illustration design more appealing to children, you can add the following style property:

style="display: block; max-width: 100%; width: initial; height: initial; background: none; opacity: 1; border: 0; margin: 0; padding: 0; animation: bounce 1s infinite;"

This new style property adds an animation called "bounce" with a duration of 1 second and infinite repetition. This animation can make the illustration more dynamic and playful, catching the attention of children.
